trans-unit.source: The DsmlInvalidDocumentException class is an exception that occurs when a DSML Request or Response document is not well-formed XML or cannot be validated with DSMLv2 schema.
The DsmlInvalidDocumentException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class.
The default text message displayed to the client is "The DSML document could not be parsed."
The DsmlInvalidDocumentException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class using the specified parameter.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.

The DsmlInvalidDocumentException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class using the specified serialization data and streaming contextual data.
The serialized object data about the exception thrown.
The contextual data about the source or destination.
The DsmlInvalidDocumentException constructor creates an instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.Protocols.DsmlInvalidDocumentException"></xref> class using the specified parameters.
The message displayed to the client when the exception is thrown.
The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException*>, if any, that threw the exception.
